item.title: Charleston’s Old South Carriage Historic Horse & Carriage Tour
item.description: Experience more than 300 years of history on this guided carriage tour of Charleston. See the many mansions, churches, and gardens as your horse-drawn carriage tour covers more than 2.5 miles and 30 blocks of historic Charleston. Belgian and Percheron draft horses will you lead you through the streets while you learn about this “Holy City” and its role in the Civil War.

image.alt: Charleston’s Old South Carriage Historic Horse & Carriage Tour

item.title: Historic Charleston Guided Sightseeing Walking Tour
item.description: Travel back in time to discover one of America’s most historic cities—Charleston, South Carolina—on this guided walking tour. Visit points of interest including Charleston City Hall; the Dock Street Theatre, America’s first theatre; the Old Exchange Building, South Carolina's most historic building; White Point Garden, in the heart of Charleston’s historic district with a spectacular view of Fort Sumter, and many more.

image.alt: Historic Charleston Guided Sightseeing Walking Tour

item.title: Charleston Horse-Drawn Carriage Tour: Explore Historic Charleston
item.description: Embark on a horse-drawn carriage tour through historic Charleston, the heart of one of America’s most charming cities. On this sightseeing tour, ride along cobblestone streets as you take in the stunning antebellum architecture, historic landmarks, and lush gardens. Your knowledgeable guide will share fascinating stories about Charleston’s rich history, Southern culture, and vibrant past. This Charleston carriage ride is the perfect way to experience the city’s unique charm.

image.alt: Charleston Horse-Drawn Carriage Tour: Explore Historic Charleston

item.title: Ghosts of Charleston Night-Time Walking Tour with Unitarian Church Graveyard
item.description: Uncover Charleston’s darkest secrets on an evening ghost tour. Stroll through the atmospheric heart of the old city while a guide regales you with tales of the dark deeds, restless spirits, and supernatural phenomena that make Charleston one of the most haunted cities in America. Get exclusive after-hour access to the famous Unitarian Church Graveyard, where an overgrown southern garden surrounds historic plots. If you choose, you can book a shorter tour with just access to the Unitarian Church Graveyard.

image.alt: Ghosts of Charleston Night-Time Walking Tour with Unitarian Church Graveyard

item.title: Haunted Evening Horse and Carriage Tour of Charleston
item.description: Get all the thrills of a Charleston ghost tour without any walking on this haunted horse and carriage ride. A horse and carriage takes you down twisting side streets and cobbled alleyways with ease as your guide shares spooky stories from Charleston’s past. Make your way past the Mills House, the Circular Congregational Graveyard, and and Provost Dungeon in the heart of the Holy City.

image.alt: Haunted Evening Horse and Carriage Tour of Charleston

item.title: Fort Sumter Admission and Self-Guided Tour with Roundtrip Ferry
item.description: Visit the site where the American Civil War began without the hassle of arranging transportation or waiting in line for tickets with this Fort Sumter experience that includes admission tickets and round-trip ferry transport. Take in views of Rainbow Row and the Battery as you cruise through Charleston Harbor, then enjoy an hour at the fort to explore the historic fort and its museum before the return ferry ride.

image.alt: Fort Sumter Admission and Self-Guided Tour with Roundtrip Ferry

item.title: Hidden Alleyways and Historic Sites Small-Group Walking Tour
item.description: Travel back in time to discover one of America’s most historic cities—Charleston, South Carolina—on this guided small-group walking tour. Explore some of the city’s most enchanting alleys and hidden passages. Visit the Old Exchange and Provost Dungeon, a colonial building with a 300-year history; Rainbow Row, the longest cluster of Georgian row houses in the United States; plus historic Philadelphia Alley, and many more.

image.alt: Hidden Alleyways and Historic Sites Small-Group Walking Tour

item.title: Highlights of Charleston Guided Walking Tour
item.description: Without a guided walking tour, you might miss some of the eclectic history and hidden nooks and crannies around Charleston that make this city such a gem. This walking tour takes you through the French Quarter and South of Broad neighborhoods to top sights such as the Rainbow Row, the Old Slave Mart Museum, and the Old Exchange, all while your guide shares stories from Charleston history and lore.

image.alt: Highlights of Charleston Guided Walking Tour

item.title: Charleston Eco Boat Cruise with stop at Morris Island Lighthouse
item.description: Cruise through Lowcountry tidal creeks and marshes en route to the uninhabited Morris Island on this boat cruise from the Charleston area. A private boat company launches from Bowens Island for the scenic ride through an estuary rich in biodiversity before a soft landing on Morris Island. Spend free time to taking photos of the historic Morris Island Lighthouse, combing for seashells, and looking out for birds, sea turtles, and dolphins before your return.

image.alt: Charleston Eco Boat Cruise with stop at Morris Island Lighthouse

item.title: Polynesian Fire Luau and Dinner Show Ticket in Myrtle Beach
item.description:
Polynesian Fire Luau is one of the hottest shows in Myrtle Beach. The entertainment event features performers from different Polynesian Isles, just for the Luau. Your evening begins with a lei greeting by dancers.
Then enjoy a buffet dinner accompanied with live music by our Polynesian band! After dinner, the show which highlights songs and dances from the different Polynesian cultures of Hawaii, Tahiti, Tonga, New Zealand and Samoa, begins. The night ends with an amazing performance by our World Champion Samoan Fire Knife Team.
All guests must arrive at St John's Inn 6803 N Ocean Blvd, Myrtle Beach no later than 6pm to check-in.

image.alt: Polynesian Fire Luau and Dinner Show Ticket in Myrtle Beach

item.title: 2-Hour Hilton Head Guided Kayak Nature Tour
item.description: Discover the natural beauty of Hilton Head Island with a guided kayaking tour. Meet your guide for a quick safety tutorial and then paddle out into the Broad Creek Wildlife Area. Keep an eye out for birds and dolphins as you explore salt marshes, tidal rivers, and creeks. Learn about the local ecosystem and history from your naturalist guide. No prior kayaking experience is necessary.

image.alt: 2-Hour Hilton Head Guided Kayak Nature Tour

item.title: Charleston Haunted Booze and Boos Ghost Walking Tour
item.description: Take a small-group tour of Charleston on this haunted boos and booze tour with your pirate guide. You can sip on cocktails (at your own expense) while your guide takes you through the city to places like the Powder Magazine, Charleston City Market, Washington Square, and more.

image.alt: Charleston Haunted Booze and Boos Ghost Walking Tour

item.title: Boone Hall Plantation All-Access Admission Ticket
item.description: Boone Hall Plantation has had a long and fascinating history since its founding near Charleston in 1681. Learn about the estate and its place in South Carolina history by visiting the plantation with an all-access admission ticket. Nine original cabins where enslaved people lived, coupled with the Black History in America exhibit, demonstrate what life was like for many people at the plantation.

image.alt: Boone Hall Plantation All-Access Admission Ticket

item.title: Charleston's Pleasing Terrors Night-Time Walking Ghost Tour
item.description: Join Charleston native and host of the popular Pleasing Terrors Podcast, Mike Brown, on this 90-minute Pleasing Terrors Night-Time Walking Ghost Tour. Join Mike as he combines suspenseful storytelling with unparalleled knowledge of the hidden and often frightening stories lurking in Charleston's past and present.

image.alt: Charleston's Pleasing Terrors Night-Time Walking Ghost Tour

item.title: Hilton Head Island Dolphin Boat Cruise
item.description: Learn about the marine life populating the waters off the coast of Hilton Head Island on this dolphin watching cruise. Up your chances of spotting dolphins and other marine animals with the help of your professional guide, who will also provide information about the ecosystem as you go.

image.alt: Hilton Head Island Dolphin Boat Cruise

item.title: Downtown Charleston Food Tour
item.description: Bring your appetite for this tasty walking tour of downtown Charleston. You’ll spend a few hours of mouthwatering fun touring the culinary side of the Holy City, learning about the history of the city as you dine at four local restaurants. Explore the French Quarter and the Market while tasting traditional and contemporary Lowcountry cuisine.

image.alt: Downtown Charleston Food Tour

item.title: Charleston City Sightseeing Bus Tour
item.description: An air-conditioned sightseeing bus offers a refreshing Charleston Sightseeing Tour for summertime visitors trying to escape the heat or those with limited mobility. Roll by popular "Holy City" sights like Rainbow Row, the Battery, White Point Gardens, Nathaniel Russell House, and St. Michael's Church from wide viewing windows while your guide informs and entertains with stories from Charleston's rich past.

image.alt: Charleston City Sightseeing Bus Tour

item.title: Charleston Walking Food Tour With Secret Food Tours
item.description: Skip the tourist traps and lose yourself in the flavors of true Charleston cuisine. Taste local delicacies like classic Carolina-style BBQ, historic She-Crab soup, and famous fried green tomatoes and, as with all of our tours, you'll also indulge in our decadent Secret Dish, which just might make you leave singing a happy song! Your local guide will steer you toward the very best spots to enjoy these classic Southern dishes.

image.alt: Charleston Walking Food Tour With Secret Food Tours

item.title: Waccamaw River Nature and Wildlife Tour
item.description: Explore the beautiful cypress-lined Waccamaw River, Intracoastal Waterway, and the creeks and swamps on this guided boat tour near Myrtle Beach, South Carolina. Be on the lookout for birds and other wildlife that inhabit these southern waters that run along the refuge. The boat docks are located within Waccatee Zoo.

image.alt: Waccamaw River Nature and Wildlife Tour

item.title: Charleston historical walking tour with a Professor of History at The Citadel
item.description: Unlike many tour companies in town that allow up to 20 people in each group, my Charleston tour is guaranteed to have no more than 12. The most unique aspect of my tour is the high level of historical professionalism that I deliver to my guests. Earning a Ph.D. in history meant spending thousands of hours reading and researching primary sources in the South Carolina archives. I use the knowledge that I have obtained from that hard work and pass it off to you on the tour. Because I limit the number of guests to 12 and offer a tour that is 45 minutes longer than most in town, you will receive a degree of exclusivity and historical depth that is far greater than what is offered by the larger tour companies in Charleston.

image.alt: Charleston historical walking tour with a Professor of History at The Citadel

item.title: 2-Hour Guided Kayak Eco Tour in Charleston
item.description: More than a welcome sight for sore eyes, the tidal marshes around Charleston are a hotbed for Lowcountry biodiversity. Keep your eyes peeled for sightings of wildlife such as Loggerhead turtles, bottlenose dolphins, and more as you paddle down Folly Creek en route to the tidal creeks that wrap around the Hammock Islands. This leisurely paced kayaking tour is capped at 12 participants for a more personalized experience.

image.alt: 2-Hour Guided Kayak Eco Tour in Charleston

item.title: Beaufort’s #1 Horse & Carriage History Tour
item.description: Explore the southern city of Beaufort aboard a horse and carriage during this small-group excursion. Enjoy a relaxing ride around the historic district while your guide regales you of stories from the Antebellum South. See Civil War sites, historic churches, and even movie sites as you tour the city.

image.alt: Beaufort’s #1 Horse & Carriage History Tour

item.title: Savor the Flavors of Charleston Walking Food Tour
item.description: Discover the delights of the Charleston food scene on this walking tour. With a guide, you'll learn about the cuisine of the Lowcountry region as you explore this historic city and sample local food products such as stone-ground grits, pralines, collard greens, and South Carolina barbecue. Tour is limited to 12 people for a small-group experience.

image.alt: Savor the Flavors of Charleston Walking Food Tour

item.title: Daufuskie Island Guided History Tour from Hilton Head
item.description: Remote Daufuskie Island is accessible only by boat and remains largely undeveloped, despite its fame as the setting of Pat Conroy’s novel “The Water is Wide.” A guided tour makes the trip a cinch—this package includes round-trip boat tickets, plus transportation between island attractions such as the First African Baptist Church and Mary Fields School, all visited with the benefit of commentary from your guide.

image.alt: Daufuskie Island Guided History Tour from Hilton Head
